extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breast halves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (6 ounces each)

recipes.title: Grilled Tomatillo Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 25 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay
productMatches.description: We barrel ferment our Chardonnay and age it in a mix of Oak and Stainless. Giving this light bodied wine modest oak character, a delicate floral aroma, and a warming finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Moisten a paper towel with cooking oil; using long-handled tongs, lightly coat the grill rack. Grill chicken, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 in. from the heat for 4-7 minutes on each side or until a thermometer reads 170°. Top with cheese; cook 1 minute longer or until cheese is melted.                                                                                           In a large skillet, saute onion in oil until tender. Add the tomatillos, lime juice and jalapenos; cook 3 minutes longer. Add garlic; cook 1 minute longer. Stir in the cilantro, cumin, salt and pepper.                                                                                            Serve tomatillo mixture and chicken with rice; dollop with sour cream if desired.                                        Yield: 4 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Grilled Tomatillo Chicken in  Taste of HomeJune/July 2010, p53                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 chicken breast half with 1/2 cup tomatillo mixture (calculated without rice and sour cream) equals 324 calories, 14 g fat (5 g saturated fat), 109 mg cholesterol, 595 mg sodium, 9 g carbohydrate, 2 g fiber, 41 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Moisten a paper towel with cooking oil; using long-handled tongs, lightly coat the grill rack. Grill chicken, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 in. from the heat for 4-7 minutes on each side or until a thermometer reads 170°. Top with cheese; cook 1 minute longer or until cheese is melted.
In a large skillet, saute onion in oil until tender.
Add the tomatillos, lime juice and jalapenos; cook 3 minutes longer.
Add garlic; cook 1 minute longer. Stir in the cilantro, cumin, salt and pepper.
Serve tomatillo mixture and chicken with rice; dollop with sour cream if desired.
